title: West Community Associates Program: Harry Who? to Hairy Who—Chicago's Famous Artists
hero_caption: Gladys Nilsson. The Great War of the Wonder Women, n.d. Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Edwin A. Bergman © Gladys Nilsson.
short_description: Guest speaker at the Naperville Municipal Center
list_description: Guest speaker at the Naperville Municipal Center
description:
Speaker: Annie Morse
Registration period: Thursday, October 18–Thursday, November 1, 2018

For a group of young, hungry artists in Chicago in the 1960s, the Abstract Expressionist movement had gone on for far too long. They were looking at the scene around them and loving what they saw: honky-tonk lights on State street, advertising everywhere, and extraordinary ordinary people. Learn more about these visionary artists and the careers that many pursue to the present day.

To reach the event planner, please contact Cynthia Frestel at (630) 355-6297, (708) 408-2006, or email cfrestel@comcast.net.

To reach the assistant event planners, contact Linda Scholle at (630) 428-0816, (630) 337-4887, or email4linda@gmail.com, or contact Jan Gipson at (330) 416-0240, (630) 370-3550, or jgipson5@comcast.net.

This Community Associates event is exclusively for current Community Associates members. Membership will be verified at the door, and refunds cannot be issued for those without a valid membership. For Community Associates events that allow guests, nonmember guests must be registered by a Community Associates member.

If you are interested in becoming a member of Community Associates, please visit artic.edu/joinnow to join both the Art Institute of Chicago and the Community Associates group of your choice.
location: Naperville Municipal Center at 400 S. Eagle St., Naperville, IL 60540
buy_button_caption: $15 per person, open to Community Associates members and their guests
